item.dc:creator: @tomato721 tomato721
item.description:
@tomato721 wrote:

[quote=“Ryan4965, post:6, topic:446039”][quote author=tomato721 link=topic=548898.msg4023796#msg4023796 date=1340203594]

When setting a variable’s value, do not use ==, use a singular =.

experience = whatever;

And NOT:

experience == whatever;

Only use == when checking its value.

but it was already = from the qunatum source

btw i found that it was declared in player.java like this private long doubleXPTimer;

what does a long variable mean
[/quote]

A long is just basically an integer which can store a bigger number.[/quote]

and what does the if statement player.isDoubleXP

check for?

does it check if its a positive integer and how would i add a command to gove a player double xp

item.title: [639]Quantum/eclipse/dementhium----can sum1 please translate this code!
item.dc:creator: @Ryan4965 Ryan4965
item.description:
@Ryan4965 wrote:

When setting a variable’s value, do not use ==, use a singular =.

experience = whatever;

And NOT:

experience == whatever;

Only use == when checking its value.

Read full topic

item.title: [639]Quantum/eclipse/dementhium----can sum1 please translate this code!
item.dc:creator: @tomato721 tomato721
item.description:
@tomato721 wrote:

[quote=“Ryan4965, post:2, topic:446039”]I recognise something like this from when I code in C#, even though I mainly code in VB.NET.

What the code is saying is it initially gets the exp and then it checks whether double exp is enabled or not.
If it is, then it will double the exp, if not, then it will just give you your normal exp rate.

It’s very similar to the IIF function you find in VB.NET (http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/27ydhh0d(v=vs.71).aspx).[/quote]
the player.isDoubleXP()is a true/false variable right? so i tried to make an if method to give the double xp like if (player.isDoubleXP()){ experience== exp * XP_MODIFIER * 2; }

but when i compiled it said it couldnt fine the experience method

Read full topic

item.title: [639]Quantum/eclipse/dementhium----can sum1 please translate this code!
item.dc:creator: @Ryan4965 Ryan4965
item.description:
@Ryan4965 wrote:

I recognise something like this from when I code in C#, even though I mainly code in VB.NET.

What the code is saying is it initially gets the exp and then it checks whether double exp is enabled or not.
If it is, then it will double the exp, if not, then it will just give you your normal exp rate.

It’s very similar to the IIF function you find in VB.NET ( http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/27ydhh0d(v=vs.71).aspx ).

Read full topic

item.title: [639]Quantum/eclipse/dementhium----can sum1 please translate this code!
item.dc:creator: @tomato721 tomato721
item.description:
@tomato721 wrote:

so today i was thinking of adding extra xp for donator and i stumbled upon this

[code] public static final double XP_MODIFIER = 15.0;

public void addExperience(int skill, double exp) {
	int oldLevel = getLevelForExperience(skill);
	int oldCombat = getCombatLevel();
	double experience;
	if (skill == ATTACK || skill == DEFENCE || skill == STRENGTH || skill == RANGE || skill == MAGIC || skill == HITPOINTS) {
		experience = exp * XP_MODIFIER;
	} else {
		experience = exp * (player.isDoubleXP() ? (XP_MODIFIER) : (XP_MODIFIER));
	}[/code]

like what does the part where it says else { experience = exp * (player.isDoubleXP() ? (XP_MODIFIER) : (XP_MODIFIER)); mean

like does it mean experience is times the xp modifier which is 15 then times it again because i dont understand what
the questionmarks does to it (player.isDoubleXP() ? (XP_MODIFIER) and what does the colon do to it code : (XP_MODIFIER));[/code]

like could you please expain what it does and ill add the rest in …

like does it mean xp times the doublexp??? then times modifier then imes modifiier??

thx! you dont need to tell me what to add just tell me what this piece of code means! i like learning by myself

Read full topic
